# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function that does what you described:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in splitstrip(text)
        # Calculate the new line length
        new_line_length = length(current_line) + length(word) + 2  # account for space and newline character

        if new_line_length > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word  # add space between words
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line if it exists
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here's an example usage:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed non risus."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```
